content.question:
Which of the following series diverge?
<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of the cosine of, open parenthesis, 2 n, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mi>cos</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>
<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, 1 plus the fraction 1 over n, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>
<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, n plus the fraction with 1 over n squared, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 10.3: (BC ONLY) The Nth Term Test for Divergence

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
